bib_record.title: Activation cross sections of deuteron-induced nuclear reactions on mercury up to 50 MeV

free_txt: The experimental results were compared to the
result calculated by the TENDL theoretical model code.

The uncertainty of the primary beam energy

The total uncertainties were obtained from the

Cross sections were measured by using charged
Activity measurement of the reaction products
was done by Gamma-spectrometry based on HPGe detectors.
Two stacked foils targets were irradiated with
Energy degradation was calculated by using the
polynomial approximation of Andersen ad Ziegler.

The energy degradation as a function of depth in the

Recoil correction was made for the monitor reaction
Targets were prepared from HgS fine powder by
sedimentation on 50 um thick Al backing. The HgS
surface was covered by 10 um Al foil.
